intro: Calytrix decandra, commonly known as the pink burr bush, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its small, pink or white flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has woody stems and produces small, spherical fruits that contain seeds. It is often found in coastal areas and sandy soils, adapting well to dry conditions. Its unique appearance and hardy nature make it a distinctive component of the Australian flora.
